intro: Coccocypselum oblongatum, commonly known as the broadleaf cactus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding visual interest to its appearance. Its leaves are typically reduced to spines, which help reduce water loss and deter herbivores. Coccocypselum oblongatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique structure and drought tolerance.
